title: Student Attention Training During Experiments: Gaze-Tracking Feedback-Based Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: An educational environment requiring advanced social domain expertise for office/administrative professionals. Conducted in mobile learning environments based on a bring-your-own-device (BYOD) approach.

learning_goals: Learners can identify attention focus areas with 80% accuracy by analyzing eye-tracking patterns while watching experimental videos
Learners can improve learner attention focus by 30% by revising experimental explanation methods based on eye-tracking data
Learners can develop instructional design capabilities to apply real-time eye-tracking feedback systems in mobile-based microlearning environments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
